nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
## Try me out
1. In the OpenAI Assistant node, make sure your OpenAI credentials are set and choose an assistant to use (you'll need to create one if you don't have one already)
2. Click the 'Chat' button below

 - In the first message, tell the AI what your name is
 - In a second message, ask the AI what your name is

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Openaiassistant Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Openaiassistant Workflow. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, set, stopAndError, memoryManager, memoryBufferWindow. It contains 15 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 15
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **OpenAI Assistant**: openAiAssistant
- **Calculator**: toolCalculator
- **Chat Memory Manager**: memoryManager
- **Chat Memory Manager1**: memoryManager
- **Aggregate**: aggregate
- **Edit Fields**: set
- **Limit**: limit
- **Chat Trigger**: chatTrigger
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- ... and 5 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
